org.cougaar.util
Class StateMachine

java.lang.Object
  org.cougaar.util.StateMachine
Direct Known Subclasses:
StackMachine
public class StateMachine
extends java.lang.Object

A little state machine framework to allow proper sequencing of a set of logical states.

Nested Class Summary
static class StateMachine.IllegalStateException
          Utility Exception for use by the StateMachine
static class StateMachine.State
          Each state in a machine extends this abstract class

Field Detail

ERROR

public static final StateMachine.State ERROR
Error state. The Machine will require a reset in order to progress

UNINITIALIZED

public static final StateMachine.State UNINITIALIZED
Default state from which you cannot transit anywhere.

DONE

public static final StateMachine.State DONE
Machine is fulfilled - will not progress from this state

Constructor Detail

StateMachine

public StateMachine()
Method Detail

step

public boolean step()
Invoke a single step to see if we should transit out of the current state. If the machine is "DONE" then no state will be invoked: perpetual no-op unless the machine is rest. If the machine is in UNINITIALIZED or ERROR state, then an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

Returns:
true IFF the current state invoked a transit method.

stepUntilDone

public void stepUntilDone()
Step until getState() returns DONE

go

public void go()
call step repeatedly until the machine doesn't transit

getState

public final StateMachine.State getState()
Return the current state

isDone

public final boolean isDone()

add

public StateMachine.State add(StateMachine.State s)
Add a State to the machine. A state with the same key as an old state will be replaced and the old one returned.

addLink

public void addLink(java.lang.String startTag,
                    java.lang.String nextTag)
Add a direct link between two tags

set

public void set(StateMachine.State s)
Sets the State of the machine. Use #reset(State) instead if explicitly skipping states or resetting a machine back to start.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - When entering ERROR or if skipping a state, e.g. if two sets are done in sequence without the opportunity to process the first one.

set

public final void set(java.lang.String k)

reset

public void reset(StateMachine.State s)
like set, except allows a machine to jump states. This is important primarily if you want to reset a machine to the initial state.

reset

public final void reset(java.lang.String k)

_set

protected void _set(StateMachine.State s)

transit

protected final void transit(StateMachine.State s)

transit

protected final void transit(java.lang.String k)

transit

protected void transit(StateMachine.State oldState,
                       StateMachine.State newState)
Transit from oldState to newState. Default implementation merely calls set(newState)
